channel.title: How to connect my source to no-ip.com
channel.description:
How do I connect my source to no-ip.com. Which file in my source do I have to edit and put in my no-ip's ip.
So that my client can connect to the no-ip's ip :P

item.title: How to connect my source to no-ip.com
item.dc:creator: @dds_asap dds asap
item.description:
@dds_asap wrote:

try hiding then unhiding the file the maker may have hidden it by accident or if not then try re-downloading you may have got a faulty download

item.title: How to connect my source to no-ip.com
item.dc:creator: @blackbird070 blackbird070
item.description:
@blackbird070 wrote:

Guys,

My last post.
So i have to do nothing to the source. And just leave that as it is.
And I have to portforward and its done.
But wait can you please tell me a good client mines get stuck. I downloaded Khanz 652 ipChanger.
But the only thing I see when I open Khanza Ip changer is just 2 files: cache and bin.
What I have to do?

item.title: How to connect my source to no-ip.com
item.dc:creator: @i0wn3v3ry i0wn3v3ry
item.description:
@i0wn3v3ry wrote:

All you have to do is portfoward, and click “Run” in your server files, I don’t know how to tell you other then that how it connects, and allows people to play, it just does.

For your client, you need to use “127.0.0.1, or 0.0.0.0” and the people you want to play need to use your no-ip.

Read full topic

item.description:
@blackbird070 wrote:

Guys

So how does the source then connects, there is no connection between no-ip and my comp/source.
And tha client thing I already know. But the client has to get the source from no-ip. But the source aint connected with no-ip. So the source isnt connected to the client. So ppl cant play

item.title: How to connect my source to no-ip.com
item.dc:creator: @i0wn3v3ry i0wn3v3ry
item.description:
@i0wn3v3ry wrote:

[quote=“recker450, post:4, topic:358031”]yea…
if your client(not the source one doesnt connect to your server ip)
look in
egui.java or
client.java
and change the ip to your server ip or 127.0.0.1[/quote]

Can you please quit posting on topics that I post on, I understand your trying to help, but you think you need to post on everything I post on.

Thanks for your cooperation,
Thomas.

Read full topic

item.source: How to connect my source to no-ip.com

item.title: How to connect my source to no-ip.com
item.dc:creator: @i0wn3v3ry i0wn3v3ry
item.description:
@i0wn3v3ry wrote:

You don’t edit anything in your Server so it connects to NO-IP, just go into your client files, and in your client.java, maybe GUI.java search your server ip - 127.0.0.1, or 0.0.0.0, and change to your no-ip.

Read full topic
item.source: How to connect my source to no-ip.com

item.title: How to connect my source to no-ip.com
item.dc:creator: @recker450 recker450
item.description:
@recker450 wrote:

nothing
just your server.java’s port has to match with the one your portforward

open your no-ip
open your run.bat
login with 127.0.0.1 or your server ip but if you cant login with your server ip try 127.0.0.1
and let other players use the server ip instead

Read full topic
